CT: antagonist of Wnt signaling; calcitonin production@calcitonin lowers serum calcium by inhibiting bone resorption; osteocalcin production@osteocalcin is produced by osteoblasts and indicates increased bone turnover; parathyroid hormone release@PTH increases calcium and decreases phosphate by promoting reabsorption in the kidney, increasing bone resorption, increasing vitamin D activation, and increasing calcium uptake from the small intestine; sclerostin production@sclerostin is secreted by osteocytes and inhibits osteoblasts
